abstract.text: Creates a person with information that indicates whether the person is the user of the device.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A string that contains information your app uses to identify the user. You can create a person handle from an email address, phone number, or account name associated with the user.
The name of the user, specified as a set of name components.
The string you display for the user’s name.
An image of the person.
The identifier associated with the user’s
object. Specify a value for this parameter when the user has a corresponding entry in the Contacts database.
A custom string that you use to identify people in your app.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the person is the current device user.
An initialized person object or
if initialization fails.
It’s important to set
when using
intents. For example, if the message sender for an outgoing message is also the user of the device, set
to
. Similarly, when creating the recipient array for an incoming message—which includes the current user of the device—set
to
for the person in the recipient list that is the current device user, and set
to
for all other recipients.
Use this method when creating person objects you plan to return as part of a response to Siri. Always specify as much information as possible about the user. This method makes copies of the
, and
parameters instead of keeping the originals.

abstract.text: An immutable object that stores information about a single contact, such as the contact’s first name, phone numbers, and addresses.
Send messages and search the user’s received messages.
Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
Image data inside an Intents extension or Intents UI extension.
Information about a person participating in a SiriKit interaction.
Creates a person with the specified name and contact information.
Creates a person with the specified name, contact, and alias information.
Creates a person with information Siri can use to suggestion the person at appropriate times.
Creates a person with information that indicates whether the person is the user of the device.
Creates a person that includes required metadata for messaging intents.
Creates a person with the specified name, contact, and relationship information.
The identifying information for a user of your app.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
The separate parts of a person's name, allowing locale-aware formatting.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
